title: Neighbors
lyrics:
I always lock the door, 'cause you never know for sure
Who your neighbors really are, real suspicious
I made my way outside in the California skies
But I couldn't feel the sunny disposition
Oh, bet you can imagine how I'm sinking



They were standing side by side, just like mugs along the shelf

With their glaze and overrise, they couldn't help it

And no matter how I try, I just couldn't feel alive

I just stepped right into line, they never felt it



Oh, bet you can imagine how I'm sinking

Oh, oh, when the signal's always busy, baby



But like Jane Doe and her John, all of us just carried on

I was looking for somebody who could shake me

Oh, I always lock the door 'cause you never know for sure

Who your neighbors really are, maybe they'll save me



Oh, bet you can imagine how I'm sinking

Oh, oh, when the signal's always busy, baby



I'm still reeling here, maybe some sign will appear

I guess I hope it comes

It's like I'm twiddling my thumbs, sometimes I can't believe

I get so numb

You think I would've figured it out by now

You're not the only one



Oh, bet you can imagine how I'm sinking

Oh, oh, when the signal's always busy, baby



Oh, won't somebody shake me?

Oh, oh, signal's loud, but it's still busy, baby
